<!-- <UL>
<H2>Activities of the Java Grande Forum I</H2>
<BR></UL></P>
<P><UL>
<LI><H2>Two major working groups promoting standards and community actions
</H2>
</UL><UL>
<LI><H2>Numerics: Java as a language for mathematics led by Ron Boisvert and Roldan Pozo from NIST
</H2>
<UL>
<LI>http://math.nist.gov/javanumerics/
<LI>(Optional) Changes in Java handling of floating point which currently has goal of reproducible results but this leads to non optimal accuracy in numeric compuations
<LI>Better Support of Complex arithmetic
<LI>Lightweight classes and Operator overloading -- enables implementation of complex as a class
<LI>“Fortran rectangular multidimensional arrays” -- Java naturally has “arrays of arrays”
<LI>High quality math libraries with agreed interfaces -- FFT, Matrices and Linear Algebra, Transcendental functions</UL></UL></P>
<P>  -->
